biography.bio: Tomoemon Otani is an actor, known for Une femme dont on parle (1954), Kanketsu Sasaki Kojirô: Ganryû-jima kettô (1951) and Sasaki Kojiro (1950).
biography.name: Tomoemon Otani

biography.bio: Hisako Yamane was born on April 11, 1921 in Tokyo, Japan. She was an actress, known for The Life of Oharu (1952), Mille et une nuits à la Tôhô (1947) and Tsuma to onna kisha: Wakai ai no kiki (1950). She died on September 15, 1990.
biography.name: Hisako Yamane

biography.bio: Hideko Takamine was born on March 27, 1924 in Hakodate, Hokkaido, Japan as Hideko Hirayama. She was an actress and assistant director, known for Nuages flottants (1955), Quand une femme monte l'escalier (1960) and L'éclair (1952). She was married to Zenzô Matsuyama. She died on December 28, 2010 in Tokyo, Japan.
biography.name: Hideko Takamine

biography.bio: Yuriko Hamada is an actress, known for Araki Mataemon: Kettô kagiya no tsuji (1952), The Life of Oharu (1952) and Kenji to onnakanshu (1949).
biography.name: Yuriko Hamada

biography.bio: Yumiko Miyagino is an actress, known for Sisters of Nishijin (1952), Sasaki Kojiro (1950) and Waga koi no lila no kokage ni (1953).
biography.name: Yumiko Miyagino

biography.bio: Kamatari Fujiwara was born on January 15, 1905 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Seven Samurai (1954), The Hidden Fortress (1958) and Yojimbo (1961). He died on December 21, 1985 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Kamatari Fujiwara

biography.bio: Mizushima was born in 1884 in Tokyo. He started out working for the Kawakami Otojiro theater group, joining Yoshizawa Shoten in 1910. After this he signed up with Nikkatsu in 1916, where he appeared in films such as Futari Shizuka (Two Quiet People), Yosho no Musume and Dokugusa, mainly in supporting roles. He did, however, play a major role in Dokugusa. In 1920, after joining Kokukatsu, he appeared in Kan Tsubaki (Cold Camellia) with Inoue Masao and Mizutani Yaeko, and he also directed films such as Ikeru Nayami and Hi no Yama. After this he returned to Nikkatsu, where he appeared in films such as Koya o Yuku, Riku no Ichiya, and Warera no Wakakihi. In 1926 Mizushima joined Shochiku Kamata Studios. Initially, he concentrated on period drama, appearing in works such as Onna Sakazaki, before moving into contemporary drama, appearing consecutively in Niwaka Gyosha and Runpen to Sono Musume. In the latter film he appeared alongside Tanaka Kinuyo. With the advent of talkies, Mizushima gave fine supporting performances in Tonari no Yaechan, Kazoku Kaigi, and Ani to Sono Imoto. After this he went on to appear in films such as Hito no Ki mo Shiranaide, Minna Mienakunaru, and Hito no Kage. At Shochiku he played mainly the parts of old men. Mizushima was known as an actor who supported the film world from the late Meiji period onwards.
biography.name: Ryôtarô Mizushima

biography.bio: Ryûnosuke Tsukigata was born on March 18, 1902 in Miyagi, Japan as Kiyoto Monden. He was an actor, known for Sanshiro Sugata (1943), Le Mont Fuji et la lance ensanglantée (1955) and La légende de judo II (1945). He died on August 30, 1970.
biography.name: Ryûnosuke Tsukigata

biography.bio: Reizaburô Yamamoto is an actor, known for Drunken Angel (1948), Sazen Tange and the Pot Worth a Million Ryo (1935) and Fleur pâle (1964).
biography.name: Reizaburô Yamamoto

biography.bio: Eijirô Tôno was born on September 17, 1907 in Gunma, Japan. He was an actor, known for Seven Samurai (1954), Yojimbo (1961) and Tora! Tora! Tora! (1970). He died on September 8, 1994.
biography.name: Eijirô Tôno

biography.bio: Kokuten Kôdô was born on January 29, 1887 in Takasago, Hyogo, Japan as Saichirô Tanigawa. He was an actor, known for Seven Samurai (1954), Throne of Blood (1957) and The Hidden Fortress (1958). He died on January 22, 1960.
biography.name: Kokuten Kôdô

biography.bio: Yoshio Kosugi was born on September 15, 1903 in Tochigi, Japan. He was an actor, known for Seven Samurai (1954), The Hidden Fortress (1958) and Mothra vs. Godzilla (1964). He died on March 12, 1968.
biography.name: Yoshio Kosugi
